speaker: Griffin
lines: Ah, okay, so, you've just kicked some robot asses, um, and got a new, more badass robot companion as a result. It was a pretty good trade off. Uh, and just took a short rest... which we did before the recording, to disguise the fact that we don't know how to do that! [Clint laughs.] You, uh... so you've made your way down this conveyor belt out of the robot manufacturing facility, and have turned off of a branch off this conveyor belt and Noelle and her new big badass robot suit kicks open a hatch into the main experiment chamber. And it certainly looks like the type of room that a climactic standoff might happen in.

speaker: Clint
lines: That's convenient…

speaker: Travis
lines: Just your standard final fight room?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah! If Dracula was a thing here...

speaker: Travis
lines: Uh huh?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He'd be... this would be his place.

speaker: Travis
lines: Is it crystallized, Griffy?

speaker: Griffin
lines: So, this is weird— it’s the first room you've been in this whole time that is only partially crystallized. There is-

speaker: Travis
lines: Percentage-wise, how much?

speaker: Justin
lines: 'Cause it spread so quickly elsewhere, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um... no... I mean, the behavior of the crystal, of everything you've seen, is it just spreads throughout everything it's touching— um, in fact, it almost looks like it's been perfectly shaped to encompass the ceiling, where it has sort of creeped in some vents in the ceiling and through some very narrow exterior windows, some exterior vents, leading outside. You can tell it's leads outside because there's a stiff Candlenights breeze blowing in. [Clint giggles.] And hanging from this crystalline amethyst ceiling you see a stalactite. The ceiling is about fifteen feet up, the stalactite reaches down about nine feet, um, and this stalactite is huge, it's made of pure amethyst and, uh...

speaker: Clint
lines: Cheese.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Amethyst and cheese... no, it's just amethyst. On the floor, immediately below you, underneath this hatch, there's a big ol' pile of deactivated robots, like the ones that you saw in the assembly room. They all have fuses in their torsos, but they're all deactivated. And opposite you on the complete opposite end of the room is the gigantic locked door that you were unable to get through when you first reached this level of the lab.

speaker: So, inside the stalactite, you see a robot, frozen, that looks far more humanoid than any you've seen before. In fact, it's kinda difficult to discern whether it's a robot or not. It has the shape of a human woman, without any kind of, like, extraneous armor plating or insane peripherals like, um, like Noelle has on her. Uh, she has a fuse in her torso, and that fuse is lit up like a christmas tree. And she’s frozen in place in the stalactite, and uh, the fuselight is the only thing you can see in there that's moving.

However, you can see she's holding an object in each hand. In her right hand, which she has extended out in front of her, she's holding a large, silver disk, that's comprised of a series of interlocking rings, etched with a really intricate pattern that kind of resembles circuitry, all leading to a bright, small light in the center of the disk, and that light is pulsing. And in her left hand, which she is holding at her side, you see a very plain looking stone. Um... directly— sorry, it's going to take me awhile to describe this room, directly in front—
Travis
lines: No, you're doing great, Griffin! I'm drunk on your words!

speaker: Griffin
lines: [grinning] Directly in front of her—

speaker: Travis
lines: You're a poet! A poet laureate, I would say.

speaker: Griffin
lines: About ten feet away, in the direction that this disk she's holding is pointing, um, you see a large, circular pedestal, uhhh, about three feet high, and floating above it is a mirror. Much like the ones you saw floating in orbit in the Cosmoscope chamber that you were in.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay…

speaker: Griffin
lines: This one is made of brilliant sapphire with an intricate platinum trim, uh, and like the Cosmoscope—

speaker: Travis
lines: And it retails for nine ninety nine!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And it can be yours for ten easy payments of ninety-nine cents!

speaker: Travis
lines: What a deal!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Like the Cosmoscope mirrors, you see, in this sapphire mirror, another world.

speaker: Travis
lines: [dramatic gasp]

speaker: Griffin
lines: And in that world, you see tens of thousands of these floating white lights, um, sailing over a giant lake comprised of swirling rainbow-hued waters. And the lights float, they occasionally interact with each other, and dive under the water, causing a ripple of light to move across the surface of the lake. It's kind of a wondrous sight, but it's made slightly less wondrous by kind of an eyesore, slightly in the background. You see an island in this lake, and on that island you see a massive fortress, uh, comprised of stone and steel. It looks like a pretty intimidating building.

speaker: Travis
lines: Like Castle Greyskull?

speaker: Griffin
lines: It actually looks more like a prison.

speaker: Travis
lines: Like Prison Greyskull?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Like Prison Greyskull. [Travis snorts.] So, between this mirror and this stalactite with the robot frozen in it you see Lucas. He's standing under the stalactite and he's holding a big stick in his hand and there's a— he's taken off one of his gloves of his Null suit and tied it around what appears to be a hammerhead at the end of this stick and is just banging this against the stalactite and not doing, like, anything to it. He's got his sleeve tied around his exposed hand that he took his glove off from, um, and he takes a few hits on this stalactite, doesn't really do anything, and kinda just falls over and slumps over his hammer. He looks completely exhausted. His head is bandaged up, which you noticed earlier, and that bandage is, you can see some blood coming through that now-

speaker: Justin
lines: [confused] So, he's inside the mirror?

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, he's between the mirror and the stalactite.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He's banging on the stalactite  trying to bust it open to get at the robot inside. He sort of slumps over, he's leaning on his hammer, uh, and when Noelle kicks that hatch open, he looks up at the three of you and he's panting and he says

speaker: Lucas
lines: [exhausted] Oh shit.

lines: Now, Griffin, real quick, from where we are, do we see any immediate, like, threat?

lines: No. Uh, nobody— I mean, you got all those robots immediately below you, but none of 'em are activated.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, the ground is not crystallized— eh, regardless, you are in your Null suits. Noelle would be at risk. Carey is fine, she's in a Null suit. Noelle might be at risk, but there's no crystal on the ground.

lines: Yeah.

speaker: Lucas
lines: Okay, stop, okay! I'll explain everything. I-- [sigh] When I contacted the Director earlier today I told her that I found the Philosopher's Stone a couple weeks ago. That was a lie.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah!

speaker: Lucas
lines: I actually found it— I've had it for four months now. I found it- I found it for my mother, Maureen. She... she spent her whole life studying the planes and the realities that lie beyond our own. The cosmoscope which I showed you earlier, that was her life's work. It's not just some room with some mirrors that let you look at the different planes; when you arrange those mirrors in a certain way, you're able to see into alternate realities, into parallel worlds. But she wasn't able to complete it because we didn't have the Philosopher's Stone. With the Stone, I was able to create the mirrors that she needed, and my mother was able to complete her life's work, but it was...

speaker: Magnus
lines: Lucas?

speaker: Lucas
lines: Yeah?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Is your mother the robot?

speaker: Lucas
lines: ...Something went wrong.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah, okay.

speaker: Lucas
lines: She insisted that she test out the cosmoscope, she wouldn't let me go in with her. And when she used it the way it was intended, her mind was destroyed. Literally. I lost her and I became obsessed with saving her. With my background in robotics and my studies in planar energies that I learned under my mother, I devised a plan. I invented the conduit, a device capable of storing a living spirit and giving it agency over a robotic body. I created that to give her a new body that she could live in, and I created the siphon which I could use to find her in the astral plane and fish her out of there and put her in her new body. When I invented those, I— I tested them out on you, Noelle, you were the first one I found. I found you in the astral plane mirror and I pulled you out and I put you in that body and I'm so sorry for dragging you into this, it was so selfish of me. But I looked for weeks and then this morning I found my mother in there.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He points at the um, he points at the mirror, at that prison that you can see inside of it. He says,

speaker: Lucas
lines: I extracted her into this custom conduit. It was my masterpiece. And I'd hoped she would be this- the brilliant, caring woman that she was in life, but her mind is just gone. She– she attacked me, and I escaped, and I went to the medbay to regroup and patch myself up, and here we are. She- she's got the Philosopher's Stone, she crystallized herself in that stalactite-

speaker: Magnus
lines: [sighing]

speaker: Lucas
lines: —she took the siphon in with her. She nearly killed me and I-I just, I have no idea why.

lines: I prefer to go by Kravitz. And I am a bounty hunter for the Raven Queen. The goddess of the natural order of life and death. I hunt down wayward souls that escape from the astral plane, or those who escape from the eternal stockade—

speaker: Griffin
lines: He's getting angrier as he is, like, counting up your tally. And as he gets angrier, his form is starting to change. His black robe is growing longer and it's fraying and billowing out behind him. His face is turning gaunt until it simply becomes a red-eyed skull. He's got his hand outstretched and a scythe forms in it from nowhere.

lines: Cooooool.

lines: Hey Lucas… psst… [Griffin He looks, he looks-] can he get here without that sapphire mirror thing?

lines: I kick him.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Kravitz is starting to look like really terrifying. But you see something else in the mirror. Something kind of unsettling in the background. [creepy ambient noise begins playing] That stone prison, the eternal stockade behind him, you see a swarm of those shimmering grey lights start to pour out of its few narrow barred windows and doors. And they are sort of gelling and morphing together to form a massive spectral hand which is slowly sneaking up on Kravitz, who continues his spiel. He says,

speaker: Kravitz
lines: I can't allow you to stay out there, you have to know that, but there's no reason for you to die violently. Just come— just come with me, go— come in easy, please.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Um, Kravitz? No, you know what, nothing. Never mind. [Clint laughs]

lines: You know, I will say, if you wanted to lure me in there, you should've stayed handsome, my fella.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah, that is an excellent point. You're getting it spooky scary!

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, and people were all ready to write slash fiction between you and me, and then you turned all skeletal.

speaker: Travis
lines: A whole bunch of artists just like had to like erase half of the portrait they had done!

speaker: Taako
lines: Piggyback rides...

speaker: Clint
lines: Taakitz! We'd call it Taakitz, that would be the shipper name.

speaker: Justin
lines: Taakitz! That's good.

speaker: Travis
lines: Taakitz, that is good!

speaker: Kravitz
lines: That’s enough! I want to know your answer. Are you coming with me or not?!

speaker: Griffin
lines: This hand is like, right behind him now.

lines: [slowly, stalling] The answer... to whether we're going to come with you or not... is...

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, this hand, this massive silvery hand grabs him suddenly, and you hear the wind just sort of get knocked out of him. And it grabs him and just slams him into the ground over and over and over and over and over again. And you hear him wailing as this hand just like… [Clint As the hand’s whaling on him!] just completely demolishes him. And lightning-quick, pulls him back into the stockade behind him. And after it—

speaker: Clint
lines: We solved the Kravitz puzzle!

lines: You can feel a vibration in the air around you. It's like someone just hit a gigantic tuning fork. lines: You hear those crinkle-tinkles coming from the ceiling, and another verse of the song plays out, but it's different this time. And together they sing the following.

speaker: Kept from our children, lovers, friends
Subject to laws we did not make
And souls of the lost will come awake
Griffin
lines: The voices just sang, in case you couldn’t understand it or in case you’re the three people in this call who didn’t hear the song [repeats the lyrics plainly]

And this silvery substance seems to make up its form; inside of it you can make out these faint faces, most of which seem to be locked in a grimace. lines: Wait, wait, before— uh, how big's the biggest chunk of, uh— so Lucas has like the targeting reticule right? Like, I know Lucas is being targeted?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He doesn't have that little fire thing above him. It just, you see all the robots point their weapons at him. Seems like without direction they just target whoever they want.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay. Would I have time to slip in my turn here, or are they gonna hit him no matter what?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, you would have had- you would have had to have told me that you wanted to take your turn before they did.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, got it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Lucas gets blasted by seventeen different lasers and he slumps to the ground. And you see some vapor coming off of him. And he ain't movin'.

speaker: Travis
lines: Cotton.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Cotton. Thick, thick, thick! He’s vaping, right now, inside of his— no, he’s just been blasted to shit.

speaker: Travis
lines: I mean, okay– listeners, we did try, both Justin and I. Just-, he was meant to die now.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You can take your turn now, Taako, if you want.

speaker: Justin
lines: Well, yeah, uhm...

speaker: Griffin
lines: We’re almost back to where you were in the order to begin with.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, I guess I should go ahead and um... I'm-a tell you what I’m gonna try... I'm gonna cast, um... [Pause] I’m gonna cast Shatter on the stalactite.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay?

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah... I'm gonna do that. Uh, it's gonna do— the stalactite's not magical, right? We've established that just ‘cause it’s weird-

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, yeah yeah yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: —doesn’t mean it’s magical. It is going to do 3d8 thunder damage. Sixteen.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You cause this stalactite— you send a big crack up it.

speaker: Travis
lines: Tee hee hee!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And that crack very slowly creeps towards the ceiling, and you send the stalactite plummeting down to the ground, and as it hits it, this stalactite just kind of continues to shatter, freeing up the robot inside of it. There’s an unintended, or perhaps intended consequence of this, is that as the crystal hits the ground, it begins to spread throughout the room, and it is moving out relatively slowly but it's creeping, it's corrupting this room. [Justin Hell yeah.] You see Noelle actually start to back up away from this spreading crystallization.

speaker: Um. She looks kind of worried about it, or she would if she had a face. Um. Uh. But this robot that was inside of the stalactite stands up, is still holding both the disc and the Philosopher's Stone... you see it stand up, and it's moving kind of erratically, it's moving, it’s acting kind of strange... it starts to walk in one direction but then it kinda jerks itself backwards towards another direction, and then one of its arms is like pointing towards the mirror and the other one is like grabbing that arm and pulling it down. It almost looks like this thing is having a fight with itself, and you see it sort of bend over into the fetal position, and from its conduit in the middle of its body, you see like a dozen of these spirits just come flying out of it, as if they've been thrown out of it, DJ Jazzy Jeff style.
Griffin
lines: The robot stands back up, it only has a- it- it has a much fainter light in its fuse in the middle right now, and you hear this robot say uh— point at Legion and say

speaker: Robot
lines: Get the hell away from my son!

speaker: Clint
lines: Niiiice!

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, that's about what I thought would happen.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Let me roll a quick initiative for… Okay. She- after she points at Legion and shouts that, she looks around the room and sees the growing crystallization and then holds the stone she was holding to her chest, and you see the crystallization just sort of get sucked back up into the stones that fell to the ground, and the spreading has stopped.

speaker: Travis
lines: Cool.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Magnus, it's your turn.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Maureen, give me the stone.

speaker: Robot (Maureen)
lines: What? Who are you?

speaker: Magnus
lines: I'm the guy who's trying to stop all of this. Trust me. Give me the stone.

speaker: Merle
lines: Self-centered much?

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, we’re a team…

speaker: Merle
lines: I mean we're helping too!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Roll a persuasion check.

speaker: Travis
lines: That’s a nineteen, plus one, twenty.

speaker: Justin
lines: She's like, mmkay.

speaker: [General noises of laughter, “cool cool. Mmh cool”]
Griffin
lines: She says

speaker: Maureen
lines: I saw you attack my son, why should I give it to you?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Roll Disadvantage because you accosted Lucas earlier.

speaker: Travis
lines: Fair enough! ...Hah! That’s a sixteen, plus one, seventeen.

speaker: Clint
lines: So because he was a douche.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says

speaker: Maureen
lines: Are you gonna help undo this?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yes.

speaker: Maureen
lines: ...Catch.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She uh, she chucks it your way. As you grab it, Magnus, you hear a voice in your head go

speaker: Philosopher's Stone
lines: Yeah, that's right, use me, use me, you can turn the world to gold! Don't you want that big old golden world? Think about how it'd line your pockets. Line your pockets, kid, you can buy all the candies and sweets you want.

speaker: Taako
lines: You're not a big enough boy to handle these kinds of objects, Magnus.

speaker: Travis
lines: As that's happening, I wanna rip the glove so it folds around it, so I've got it in like a little sack, think of it that way— like my Null suit glove?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, you've got a little sack.

speaker: Clint
lines: You’ve got a tiny little sack, we wanna make sure we’ve got this straight. [Travis Yep.]

speaker: Philosopher's Stone [muffled]
lines: You don't want the candies and sweets, come on, think about it—

speaker: Travis
lines: I tap it with the Glutton's Fork and I swallow it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [intensely] What the fuck.

speaker: Clint
lines: You have been holding on to that one!

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes, I have.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I'm gonna have to— This is like the most magical object that there is.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yep.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, I'm saying Glutton's Fork works on non-magic— this is like the MOST magical...

speaker: Travis
lines: I thought it was just, it's gotta be small enough to eat it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, small non-magical objects.

speaker: Travis
lines: But I'm doing it with the glove.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You can eat this thing but it's gonna stay a stone.

speaker: Travis
lines: That's fine, I'm not gonna digest it—

speaker: Griffin
lines: [increasingly agitated] You can wrap this thing in a fucking- you can wrap this thing in a fucking Hot Pocket but it's still gonna be a magical-ass-- [crosstalk]

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, it's in my tummy.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Make a fucking constitution saving throw to see if you can swallow this fucking rock that you're trying to eat with your mouth and put in your body...

speaker: Travis
lines: That’s a fifteen plus three— eighteen!

speaker: Griffin
lines: You have-, I guess you turned your glove into a delicious pastry crust that you have wrapped around the Philosopher's Stone, and then through some doing—

speaker: Justin
lines: He turned it into the Falafeler's Stone!

speaker: Griffin
lines: —you have swallowed this thing, and it sucks, ‘cause you can hear this fucking Joe Pesci-ass voice from inside your gullet, now, shouting up into your body.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yep. And then I’m gonna smash the mirror.

speaker: Justin
lines: Wait Trav, don’t— [crosstalk]

speaker: Griffin
lines: What was the point of eating the rock?

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, I don’t know what you got out of that, but dude—

speaker: Travis
lines: Well, I wanted to digest it, but then you said it was magical, but at that point I’d already committed to the idea of eating a rock, and now I figure it’s just safe in my tum-tum.

speaker: Clint
lines: [quietly, in the background while Travis is talking] Poop it out! Poop it out!

speaker: Justin
lines: Don’t forget to get your 2d6 points worth of health, Trav. [giggling]

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh yeah, thank you! Uh huh. One… one! That’s two points!

speaker: Justin
lines: ...for eating whatever detritus hoves into your field of vision!

speaker: Griffin
lines: You actually also take two points of damage for swallowing a motherfucking rock.

speaker: Travis
lines: Balances out! So now it's safe in my tummy.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And spoiler alert, you're gonna take a lot mo' damage than that when it comes time to get it out.

speaker: Travis
lines: That's fair. And now I'm gonna smash the mirror.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, make a melee attack, roll against that mirror.

speaker: Travis
lines: Sixteen plus seven, twenty-three!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Yeah, roll damage.

speaker: Clint
lines: [muttering] This is gonna tear his butt up, isn't it? I know that's gonna happen…

speaker: Travis
lines: Four, plus… so that’s… ten damage.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. That's not a lot, but with your two-handed battle-axe swing, you put the smallest, smallest crack into this thing. And the picture behind it just vanishes, and the disc falls to the ground. Make a dexterity saving throw for me.

speaker: Travis
lines: That’s not gonna do it. Five plus two, seven.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh my. Imma roll a 1d2, flip a coin, just see which way this thing falls. [dice] Yeah, it's falling Magnus-ward. This thing falls on you, Magnus, and you take… [dice] 14 points of damage [Travis Oh, that’s not that bad.] as it lands on top of you and you are pinned underneath this deactivated mirror.

speaker: Travis
lines: It’s not that bad. Could be worse.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah. Could be worse.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And as you deactivate it, you hear Legion just kind of scream in anger and that is... it?

speaker: Travis
lines: We did it! [sings the Final Fantasy victory fanfare]

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, Legion... is still definitely, definitely in this room.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Carey and Noelle do some dope shit and they take out five robots.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, that’s not gonna do it. Noelle with two of her four arms grabs a robot, tears it in half, and then throws the two chunks at two more robots, taking them out. And Carey slides underneath one's knees and grabs its feet and pulls it to the ground and then chucks it at another one, taking out a fifth.

speaker: Travis
lines: I just wanna take a moment here to say that I regret eating the Philosopher's Stone.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, it seemed like kind of pointless—

speaker: Travis
lines: It seemed like a great idea when I thought I could eat the stone itself, and then you were like, “But it’s magical!” And I was like, “I'm still gonna do it!” And I was like, “Aww….”.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You hear the Falafeler's Stone inside you go,

speaker: Falafeler's Stone
lines: [muffled] Hey, Magnus, is it weird that I’m kinda into this?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Oh no, it's a vore thing! Oh God!

speaker: Falafeler's Stone
lines: I'm learning all kinds of stuff about myself right now. I think we can still turn the world into gold or candy, sweets...

speaker: Travis
lines: I punch myself in the stomach.

speaker: Falafeler's Stone
lines: Gah. Okay, okay, okay!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Legion is next. All of the silver goo has sort of brought itself back to the center of the room, and has sort of come back together on top of this pedestal, and reformed— now it's just like half a skeleton- half a gigantic skeleton, but it no longer has access to the astral plane and all of the benefits therein. Um, so... it is going to... just attack the prone Magnus [murmurs of agreement] who's pinned under the mirror. Twice. And you're gonna have Disadvantage, or I guess he’s going to have Advantage because he’s attacking a prone target.

speaker: Travis
lines: Cool.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That is a twenty-one versus AC.

speaker: Travis
lines: That is a hit, yes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And a nineteen versus AC.

speaker: Travis
lines: I mean both of those hit, yes. Um, I'm gonna use Parry, though.

speaker: Griffin
lines: To reduce damage?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, we know what it does, just roll to do it.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, okay. Okay, that’s ten, twelve- so it reduces it by twelve.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It was going to be forty-three—

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh my Jesus.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So, thirty-one points of damage.

speaker: Travis
lines: Hoooo, Boysie. Yeah, I’m still alive.

speaker: Clint
lines: What are you getting down to?

speaker: Travis
lines: I'm down to sixteen, Dad, thank you for asking.

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, I don't have a freaking tricorder on me, I can't keep up with it.

speaker: Travis
lines: No no no, that was not sarcastic, literally thank you for asking! I appreciate your concern! [Clint Aww.] I have a real hard time sounding sincere, it's a real-life problem I deal with.

speaker: Clint
lines: I love you, son.

speaker: Travis
lines: I love you too, Dad!

speaker: Griffin
lines: You, uh - Next in the order is Maureen. She runs over to Lucas and she smashes her hands into the ground and she just keeps doing that over and over and over again, just kind of mangling her hands, but exposing some active wires. And she holds those up against her sort of ruined hands and puts them up against Lucas's chest.

speaker: Clint
lines: Clear!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, literally like defibrillating him. And... let's do a first aid check. [dice] That's a crit.

speaker: Travis
lines: He jumps up! He’s better than ever! He’s ten feet tall!

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, he doesn't jump up. After a few pumps, you see him open his eyes and…

speaker: Lucas
lines: [shallow, gasping breaths]

speaker: Clint
lines: Of course all that would've taken about ten minutes because that's what happens in the movies, and at some point somebody had to have yelled at him, “Don't you die on me!” Right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, yeah, all of that happened in the span of this turn. [Clint Good, good!] Yeah, Merle, you are up.

speaker: Merle
lines: [distraught] I've been through a rough... a rough campaign here. I've had my arm chopped off. I'm not sure how I feel about Pan, ‘cause God lied— we've been all through that. I'm having a moment. I need guidance. I'm gonna take just a second just to do a quick prayer. I'm just gonna pray to Pan.

speaker: Travis
lines: Meanwhile, everyone just kinda looks around awkwardly.

speaker: Merle
lines: Hope he answers! I’ll do it quick. Pan, if you're there, and if you're not a big fat liar, tell me what to do!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, hold on, let me think about this. [mystical music starts up] Golden leaves very slowly start to bud and sprout from your soulwood arm. Sort of enshrouding it in a patchy bush of these golden leaves.

speaker: Travis
lines: Hee hee hee hee!

speaker: Griffin
lines: [amused] And- gross. And your hand, the branches that have formed your soulwood hand, sort of mold your fingers into a finger-gun and points directly at the— Legion.

speaker: Merle
lines: [choked up] Thank you!

speaker: Clint
lines: I look at Legion and I cast Banishment. This is where I send the creature to another plane of existence. They've got to make a charisma saving throw or they're banished.

speaker: Justin
lines: How charismatic are a pile of ghosts?

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, they can’t be very charismatic, right?

speaker: Travis
lines: Nah, especially since they're just like a weird skeleton thing.

speaker: Justin
lines: No. The only charismatic ghost is Slimer.

speaker: Clint
lines: Here I go. I'm gonna cast this. And I look at him and I say

speaker: Merle
lines: You! Shall not— oh, no, I’m sending him to somebody— You had better— You shall pass! Get out of here!

speaker: Travis
lines: Aaaaah, you're banished!

speaker: Griffin
lines: I-- so this thing is-- Normally, like, you can't banish something this big and bad, but you have weakened this thing to a pretty critical state—

speaker: Travis
lines: And he’s got Pan’s help.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And you've got the help of Pan, so I'll roll disadvantage on this roll. Oh, the second one was an eleven. Those golden leaves that sprouted from your hand force your thumb down as if the finger-gun has just fired, [Clint laughing] and the leaves blow, as if-- with a breeze that is coming in through the windows, encircling the giant skeleton, who you hear shout

speaker: Legion
lines: NOOOOOO!

speaker: Griffin
lines: As it is, it sort of implodes in on itself, creating like a small— not a black hole as much as like a very small silvery hole that seems to suck in the remaining twenty-three robots all around the room, the spirits blast out of the conduits inside of them, get pulled into this silvery hole, and in an explosion of golden leaves, they disappear.

speaker: Travis
lines: Della Reese looks on.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Della Reese smiles.

speaker: Travis
lines: [speaking for Della Reese] “You've done it.”
